Name: Issue 346
Introduction: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #346 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI communities this week. Sorry for the late edition last week, but this week I have come through with the goods and released a day early ;-)  Mostly because I'm going away camping with the family over the weekend! Exciting news this week though - Maui Release Candidate has been released! So stop reading this and go download it. Until next week, take care. Kym

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI Release Candidate - Ready for cross-platform app development
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI Release Candidate is now feature complete, API stable for the upcoming GA release. Get started today to build app for Android, Windows, iOS, and macOS.
Articles.Author: David Ortinau

Articles.Title: Enable continuous integration and delivery for Xamarin/.NET MAUI
Articles.Description: To create a rapidly scaling mobile solution you will need to enable continuous delivery & continuous integration. The goal is to fully automate a build that kicks off every time a change is merged in, then ship the build to testers.
Articles.Author: Jon Nichols

Articles.Title: Using Android Tiramisu Preview Workloads in Azure Pipelines
Articles.Description: Had the pleasure of hitting a bug in the net6.0-android TFM when targeting Android 31. This bug had been fixed in a preview version of the net6.0-android workload, targeting Android 32 or higher.
Articles.Author: Tomasz Cielecki

Articles.Title: Validation Rules for .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: Improve the quality of your application data using validation rules for .NET MAUI now it's available for your projects.
Articles.Author: Luis Matos

Articles.Title: Replicating Foodora UI in .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: This multipart series looks at testing out .NET MAUIâ€™s capabilities by replicating a UI for an existing application.
Articles.Author: Andreas Nesheim

Articles.Title: Introducing the New .NET MAUI Linear Gauge Control
Articles.Description: Syncfusion announces it's .NET MAUI Linear Gauge which is a multipurpose data visualization control. It shows numerical values on a linear scale in horizontal or vertical orientations.
Articles.Author: Sheik Syed

Articles.Title: Sands of MAUI: Issue #52
Articles.Description: Sam's update of MAUI related news.
Articles.Author: Sam Basu

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI Release Candidate (RC) 1
Articles.Description: A new release of .NET MAUI bring us at Release Candidate 1 (RC1). This means all APIs are finalized and we're getting ready for the final release! But one thing at a time, let me first tell you all about this release of .NET MAUI.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI Community Standup - One month till MAUI! It's go time!
Articles.Description: Join Maddy and David for the latest roundup of news and PRs as we inch closer to shipping .NET MAUI!
Articles.Author: Xamarin Developers

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI Community Toolkit Monthly Standup (April 2022)
Articles.Description: Recent updates and upcoming changes to the .NET MAUI Community Toolkit!
Articles.Author: .NET Foundation

Articles.Title: Encrypt Database with SQLite-net and .NET MAUI (or Xamarin.Forms!)
Articles.Description: In this video we will see how to create and work with a SQLCipher encrypted database in .NET MAUI. The code that is shown will also still work with Xamarin.Forms. I will walk you through the existing code I created in a previous video with the CRUD actions for SQLite and then proceed with how to encrypt your database with sqlite-net-sqlcipher.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Track Users Location in the Background with Android and Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Learn how to track a users or device location in the background on Android. Using Xamarin.Forms and Essentials, we will see how to implement a foreground service on Android that tracks the users location even when the app is in the background, killed or even when the device is restarted!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis
